alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Atlantic, Camden, east central Gloucester and west central Burlington Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 548 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sicklerville, or 14 miles southeast of Gloucester City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Evesham, Voorhees, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Hammonton, Pitman, Clayton, Berlin, Chesilhurst, Sicklerville, Atco, Victory Lakes, Williamstown, Marlton Lakes, Turnersville, Monroe Township, Echelon, Marlton, Springdale and Greentree. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 30 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
